The Good, the Bad, and the Neutral (nature's effect to tech aquisition)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Battles: The Good, the Bad, and the Neutral (nature's effect to tech aquisition)
By RNA on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 12:22 pm:

Okay, recently I've decided that sometimes a monster can't be Good OR Bad in order to learn certain techs- it's gotta be neutral. I had a Shogun (Durahan/???) that never learned V-Slash and Kick Combo, and it was Good/Best-natured before I really started training it, and never fell in morality. On the other hand, a Ruby Knight (also Durahan/??? that's worth the price of the CD) I just got done with started as Neutral, where I made sure to keep it ('cause I just wanted it that way), and V-Slash was one of its first moves, Kick Combo coming later. I think this is worth looking into.

(Oh, and I'll have the Pixie Move List ready soon.)

-- Nate Railsback (ChimeraMan101@aol.com), January 12, 2000

Answers

I often wondered why I couldn't get kick combo and v-slash. Thanks for the insight, Nate. I'll keep that in mind the next time I raise a durahan.

-- RNA (RNA@Ribosome.nuc), January 17, 2000.
